text: I am trying out the SFCD memory game app, since I realized I have 2 phones that can run it
And it does not use wifi direct... all participating phones have to be on a common subnet of a wifi network, and the server uses multicast to announce itself to clients
and that approach is definitely not going to be generalizable
it's very crashy with just 1 server/1 client
oh wow. I didn't realize that. They have the P2P example code stack in the app, I just assumed it was using that
well, the memory game at least uses that client/server approach, I'm going to see about the video and whack-a-mole demos
video demo uses same, and doesn't sync properly at all
yeah. i had 0 luck with the video demo.
I was never able to get an mDNS thing working on KitKat+
fwiw
P2P works fine, but not a generic bonjour approach
and their P2P implementation is sort of like mDNS
I'm testing it against a Jellybean phone and a Lollipop phone with different screen resolutions just to be cantankerous
hahaha
whack-a-mole is not too interesting, one screen has the game and the other screen is a scoreboard
I'm working on setting up and testing the possible codebase, but I need to update Node and a bunch of packages to start the server
ugh, even a fresh Node install is all messed up
node 0.12 doesn't seem to be very compatible with OSX 10.10, I'm chasing all kinds of failures and hangs just trying to install packages
all right, I think I fixed all my node problems and got the server running
<@U02F90CRQ>: Welcome, Rob!
<@U02F90CRQ|robt> has joined the channel
